items.sentence: I want to thank my mom and dad for always helping me.
I want you to admit that maybe you like Tom a little.
Tom certainly sounds like he\'s not planning to come.
Tom checked his odometer to see how far he\'d driven.
Tom seldom makes mistakes when he\'s speaking French.
I can\'t buy this because I don\'t have enough money.
Do you have any idea who\'d want to steal Tom\'s car?
Tom made it clear that he wasn\'t willing to do that.
I don\'t think that Tom has enough money to buy that.
Give me your passport, Tom. I\'ll keep it in my safe.
When I\'ve finished my homework, I\'ll go for a swim.
Tom says he usually buys a new car every three years.
I assume that Tom would like to go to Boston with us.
I assume this is due to the fact that Tom is a minor.
I don\'t think Tom knows when Mary came to Australia.
It\'s been three years since I began studying French.
It\'s great that you were able to achieve your goals.
It\'s hard to tell whether Tom is laughing or crying.
I would\'ve never met you if I hadn\'t broken my leg.
There\'s something I have to do before Tom gets here.
The Internet is now something we can\'t live without.
Tom lay on the couch, staring blankly at the ceiling.
Tom left the country the day after Mary went missing.
Tom let me read the letter he had received from Mary.
Tom and Mary reached the front door at the same time.
Tom and Mary used to talk to each other all the time.
Tom believes he can succeed where others have failed.
Help yourselves. There\'s plenty more in the kitchen.
Here\'s some money. Go buy yourself something to eat.
Tom asked me which team I thought would win the game.
Tom asked someone sitting near the window to open it.
Tom lives in a small house on the other side of town.
Tom didn\'t know that Mary didn\'t understand French.
Do you know of any good inexpensive hotels in Boston?
Do you still work as many hours a day as you used to?
I know that the last thing you want to do is hurt me.
Tom happened to have the day off on Mary\'s birthday.
Tom is trying very hard to get that done before 2:30.
How come none of my babysitters ever looked like you?
Tom began to talk as soon as Mary was out of earshot.
Tom checked the door to make sure that it was locked.
Tom stayed up all night. Now he\'s too tired to work.
Tom still doesn\'t know that Mary and I are divorced.
Tom told me that he\'s not certain what he should do.
There\'s a white van parked in front of Tom\'s house.
Tom didn\'t mention that this morning when I saw him.
Tom didn\'t have enough time to do what he had to do.
Tom said he didn\'t think Mary should do that inside.
Tom said he wished he didn\'t have to change schools.
Maybe the doctor can give Tom something for the pain.
